title: What is the difference between built in WiFi and WIFI enabled? - Quora

response.answer_text: WiFi ready means you have to buy an adapter to make it work. Built in means it’s got all the parts needed to work and join wireless network. WiFi ready is a marketing ploy to make you think it’s ready to join you network but they saw the uninformed consumer coming…and you have to buy a (usually) very overpriced piece of hardware to join a network.
